DOC.detailed_description: Pancreaticojejunal anastomosis leakage major complication pancreatoduodenectomy various technical method examine improve situation , e.g. , pancreatic duct occlusion , anastomosis reinforcement fibrin glue , placement internal stent , pancreaticogastrostomy . However , none method successful improve result accord finding prospective randomize study . Some retrospective study report low pancreatic fistula rate catheter insert pancreatic duct externally drain pancreatic juice . Furthermore , recent prospective randomize trial show external drainage pancreatic duct decrease rate pancreatic fistula formation indicate divert pancreatic juice anastomosis theoretically reduce incidence pancreaticojejunostomy anastomotic leakage . We propose active drainage pancreatic juice use suction drainage might maximize advantage stent finally reduce pancreaticojejunal anastomosis leakage . We enroll patient underwent duct-to-mucosa pancreaticojejunostomy reconstruction pancreatoduodenectomy , randomly allocate two group close suction drainage group ( CD group ) natural drainage group ( ND group ) operation . Preoperative demographic clinical data , surgical procedure , pathologic diagnosis , postoperative course complication detail collect prospectively . The primary study endpoint ; pancreatic fistula rate , severity pancreatic fistula , postoperative complication , postoperative length hospital stay , hospital mortality rate .
